name: reformat
content:
reformat verb [T or I]
(COMPUTER DISK)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to prepare a computer disk for use with a particular type of computer for a second, third, etc. time: I had to re-format my hard disk and reinstall everything. If you don't have the skill to fix your PC, the best idea is to re-format and start fresh.
More examplesFewer examplesDo not panic, therefore, if you accidentally reformat a disk that has useful data.Before you reformat your device, it is recommended that you back up your phone memory.Pages written in XML can automatically re-format themselves for convenient access by computer, telephone, or other devices.

reformat verb [T or I]
(TEXT)
to organize or arrange text according to a chosen pattern for a second, third, etc. time, especially on a computer: The app re-formats the pages to look good and save paper when printed out. If the text isn't quite right, I can always reformat.
More examplesFewer examplesYou can also use auto-fill to re-format a paragraph after you've edited some text in it and it is no longer nicely filled out.You may have to completely reformat some documents if the documents you are creating are very complex.I did some reformatting of the proposal and a spelling check.
